p:
Nonetheless, although described by those working in the clinics as ‘exemplary adherers’ with undetectable viral loads, participants did report missing doses occasionally and intermittently—when on CT or outside of the prescribed SCT days. Participants interpreted stable viral load results as justification to avoid reporting ‘slippages’ to their clinicians:
I try not to hide anything, it's just that I probably feel like a smidge ashamed … because I'd have told them if they asked, but if they didn't ask then and I find out my viral load was undetectable then I just let out a sigh of relief and keep going. (USA, SCT arm)
